nl.tudelft.ti1100a.audio
Interface RhythmListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
RhythmListenerAdapter
public interface RhythmListener

A RhythmListener can 'listen' to a Rhythm. The Rhythm will let the listner know when a measure or a beat starts.

Author:
Mara Bos (m-ou.se@m-ou.se)
See Also:
Rhythm

Method Summary
 void beat()
          This method is called on every beat, except for the beat that starts a measure.
 void isPlayingChanged()
          This method is called when the Rhythm starts or stops playing.
 void measure()
          This method is called at the start of a measure.
 void positionChanged()
          This method is called when the position in the current measure changes in a unusual way.
 void tempoChanged(float factor)
          This method is called when the tempo changes.
 

Method Detail

beat

void beat()
This method is called on every beat, except for the beat that starts a measure.

isPlayingChanged

void isPlayingChanged()
This method is called when the Rhythm starts or stops playing.

measure

void measure()
This method is called at the start of a measure.

positionChanged

void positionChanged()
This method is called when the position in the current measure changes in a unusual way. For example, when the current measure is reset.

tempoChanged

void tempoChanged(float factor)
This method is called when the tempo changes.

Parameters:
factor - The relative change in tempo.
